reviewText: I used to have a bunch of these on VHS so many years ago.  It was wonderful to be able to buy these and share them with my nephew.  I just wish all of them were available on DVD.
Got good service, great price, Ive never seen this and my grand kids will enjoy this, came in good condition
IF YOU LOVED DISNEYS 20,000 LEAGUES UNDER THE SEA, YOU WILL TREASURE THE ANIMATED VERSION! THE BEST OF THE ANIMATED VERSIONS PRODUCED (I OWN THEM ALL!)  WELCOME CAPTAIN NEMO...YOU WERE MISSED.

"Around the World in 80 Days" and "20000 Leagues under the Sea"
This DVD is twice the 45 min running time of Vol 2 or Vol 3.
These two stories were the two in the Festival of Family Classics 1971 series, which were two parters.
Appropriately grouped together on this DVD, they appeal not only to Rankin Bass fans, but also readers of the author Jules Verne, whose novels were the basis of both stories.
So you're actually getting not two, but four episodes.
Check out my detailed review for Volume 2, especially Australian buyers.

From the same folks who brought you the Christmas favorites Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer & Frosty the Snowman, this contains episodes from the 70's TV series they did in the same animated style as Frosty the Snowman.  I thought 20000 Leagues Under the Sea was particularly enjoyable.
